t: Lamentations 3
Hope through God’s Mercy
א Aleph
I*pn am the man who has seen affliction under*ln the rod of God’s wrath.
He*ln has driven me away and forced me to walk in*ln darkness instead of light.
Yes,*ln he repeatedly turns his hand against*ln me all day long.
ב Beth
He*pn has worn away my flesh and skin; he*ln has broken my bones.
He*ln has laid siege against me, encircling*ln me with bitterness and hardship.
He*ln has made me dwell in darkness like*ln those who have been dead for ages.
ג Gimel
He*pn has walled me in so I cannot get out; he*ln has weighed me down with chains.
Even*ln when I cry out and plead for help, he*ln blocks out my prayer.
He*ln has walled in my ways with blocks of stone; he*ln has made my paths crooked.
ד Daleth
He*pn is a bear waiting in ambush, a*ln lion in hiding.
He*ln forced me off my way and tore me to pieces; he*ln left me desolate.
He*ln strung his bow and*ln set me as the target for his arrow.
ה He
He*pn pierced my kidneys with*ln shafts from his quiver.
I*ln am a laughingstock to all my people, mocked*ln by their songs all day long.
He*ln filled me with bitterness, satiated*ln me with wormwood.
ו Waw
He*pn ground my teeth with gravel and*ln made me cower in the dust.
I*ln have been deprived of peace; I*ln have forgotten what prosperity is.
Then*ln I thought, “My future is lost, as*ln well as my hope from the Lord.”*s
ז Zayin
Remember*pn my affliction and my homelessness, the*ln wormwood and the poison.
I*ln continually remember them and*ln have become depressed.
Yet*ln I call this to mind, and*ln therefore I have hope:
ח Cheth
Because*pn of the Lord’s*s faithful love we*ln do not perish, for*ln his mercies never end.
They*ln are new every morning; great*ln is your faithfulness!
I*ln say, “The Lord*s is my portion, therefore*ln I will put my hope in him.”
ט Teth
The*pn Lord*s is good to those who wait for him, to*ln the person who seeks him.
It*ln is good to wait quietly for*ln salvation from the Lord.*s
It*ln is good for a man to bear the yoke while*ln he is still young.
י Yod
Let*pn him sit alone and be silent, for*ln God has disciplined him.
Let*ln him put his mouth in the dust— perhaps*ln there is still hope.
Let*ln him offer his cheek to*ln the one who would strike him; let*ln him be filled with disgrace.
כ Kaph
For*pn the Lord will*ln not reject us forever.
Even*ln if he causes suffering, he*ln will show compassion according*ln to the abundance of his faithful love.
For*ln he does not enjoy bringing affliction or*ln suffering on mankind.
ל Lamed
Crushing*pn all the prisoners of the land beneath*ln one’s feet,
denying*ln justice to a man in*ln the presence of the Most High,
or*ln subverting a person in his lawsuit— the*ln Lord does not approve of these things.
מ Mem
Who*pn is there who speaks and it happens, unless*ln the Lord has ordained it?
Do*ln not both adversity and good come*ln from the mouth of the Most High?
Why*ln should any living person complain, any*ln man, because of the punishment for his sins?
נ Nun
Let’s*pn examine and probe our ways, and*ln turn back to the Lord.*s
Let’s*ln lift up our hearts and our hands to*ln God in heaven:
“We*ln have sinned and rebelled; you*ln have not forgiven.
ס Samek
“You*pn have covered yourself in anger and pursued us; you*ln have killed without compassion.
You*ln have covered yourself with a cloud so*ln that no prayer can get through.
You*ln have made us disgusting filth among*ln the peoples.
פ Pe
“All*pn our enemies open*ln their mouths against us.
We*ln have experienced panic and pitfall, devastation*ln and destruction.”
My*ln eyes flow with streams of tears because*ln of the destruction of my dear people.
ע Ayin
My*pn eyes overflow unceasingly, without*ln end,
until*ln the Lord*s looks down from*ln heaven and sees.
My*ln eyes bring me grief because*ln of the fate of all the women in my city.
צ Tsade
For*pn no reason, my enemies hunted*ln me like a bird.
They*ln smothered my life in a pit and*ln threw stones on me.
Water*ln flooded over my head, and*ln I thought, “I’m going to die!”
ק Qoph
I*pn called on your name, Lord,*s from*ln the depths of the pit.
You*ln heard my plea: Do*ln not ignore my cry for relief.
You*ln came near whenever I called you; you*ln said, “Do not be afraid.”
ר Resh
You*pn championed my cause, Lord; you*ln redeemed my life.
Lord,*sln you saw the wrong done to me; judge*ln my case.
You*ln saw all their vengefulness, all*ln their plots against me.
שׂ Sin / שׁ Shin
Lord,*spn you heard their insults, all*ln their plots against me.
The*ln slander and murmuring of my opponents attack*ln me all day long.
When*ln they sit and when they rise, look, I*ln am mocked by their songs.
ת Taw
You*pn will pay them back what they deserve, Lord,*s according*ln to the work of their hands.
You*ln will give them a heart filled with anguish. May*ln your curse be on them!
You*ln will pursue them in anger and destroy them under*ln your heavens.
